titles: Die Veneris 11. Junii 1647. Ordered by the Lords and Commons assembled in Parliament, that the excise of flesh bee taken off from and after the foure and twentieth day of this instant June, and that from and after the said day the said excise cease and be no longer paid. Joh. Brown Cler. Parliamentorum. Die Veneris 11. Junii 1647. Ordered by the Lords and Commons assembled in Parliament, that the excise of salt made in this kingdome bee taken off ...
author: England and Wales. Parliament.
publisher: printed for John Wright at the Kings Head in the Old Bayley,
notes: Two votes repealing excise of flesh and salt.
Reproduction of original in the William Andrews Clark Memorial Library.
keywords: Excise tax --  England --  Early works to 1800.
Great Britain --  History --  Civil War, 1642-1649 --  Early works to 1800.
